body.p: To His Excellency Gov Thos. E. Bramlett

Your Petitioner Thomas J Cliff of Grant County Kentucky doth hereby respectfully represent unto Your Honor that He has been Indicted for the Offense of Killing a Neighbors horse by Shooting &. &. He States emphatically that He is not guilty of Said Offense and that Said Indictment was procured by Malicious Persons & for Malicious purposes, and that at the time of His trial for Said Offense it was impossible for him to Show His innocence by proof. He an ^had^ an only witness by which He Could have Shown His innocence Conclusively by, the man who was really guilty of the Offense, was His witness & it was impossible to procure him. His Attorney advised him to go to trial & he was fined $88 -- & costs -- he represents that He is wholy unable to pay the fine He is a very poor man & a large Family to Support by His Own labor & if He is forced to pay the Same. His family must suffer. He therefore Petitions Your honor for the remission of Said fine & he will ever pray &. &. His neighbors Jonies herewith in the above Petition & asks the remission of Said fine, & also State that they belive the facts Set out in Said Petition to be true.

James Ford

I Simein Jackson of Grant County State of Kentucky do hereby State that I was present when the horse was Shot for which Thomas Cliff was Indicted & fined in the Grant Circuit Court and I further State that I know He did not Shoot the horse nor neither is He guilty in any manner of Said charge.
The above affidavit was subscribed and Sworn to before me by Simeon Jackson this 9 day of Dec 1863
W. W. Sipple T. P. G. C
